body:
These two produce dimly lit atmospheres:

``` yaml
Red: 100
Green: 100
Blue: 80

Red: 125
Green: 50
Blue: 90
```

Updated using floats:

``` yaml
    GlobalLightingPaletteEffect:
        Ambient: 0.5
        Red: 0.95
        Green: 0.85
        Blue: 1.25
```
This will be pretty nice to spice up the Tanya, spy and commando missions.  The lightning effect needs some more work, though, it looks more like strobe light than lightning.

Ouch, that's exactly what I was working on today, too x)
Don't worry though, your approach is vastly superior to what I had come up with in most aspects.

The only advantages of my approach are (or were) that you could define explicit transition durations between the four day times + extra delays for day->evening and night->morning transitions (since night and day are supposed to last longer than morning and evening), and you could set RGB for each of the 4 day times individually, so you could have reddish evening, blueish dark night, sunny yellowish morning and cloudy greyish day.

My implementation is pretty hacky though, (ab)using the MenuPaletteEffect.
Edit: And no lightning.

This has an odd, yet expected, effect on remap.
Neutral actors are of course grayscale so they just get ramped up while player actors aren't quite grayscale.
![screen shot 2015-04-04 at 3 27 15 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/6994433/376c459e-dadf-11e4-8541-e66fe24a840e.png)

@reaperrr Maybe do your day night cycle based on this PR which is actually just a parametrized version  of https://github.com/chrisforbes/OpenRA/tree/weather-test by @chrisforbes. Also @cjshmyr was working on something similar https://github.com/cjshmyr/OpenRA/commit/b7d22702ee04b0c21b0b3394eb6eb7927544dc3c but never completed it.

When I was playing with night + lightning effects, I found the crack of
thunder was crucial to making the illusion work.

On Sun, Apr 5, 2015 at 8:07 AM, Taryn Hill notifications@github.com wrote:

> This looks pretty nice:
> 
> Red: 100Green: 100Blue: 80
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7863#issuecomment-89654226.
Looking at the original Tiberian Sun triggers for day/night cycle, this may want to be exposed to the Lua API instead. https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/58357192/OpenRA/Day-Night%20Loop.txt
For TS you'll want to add `ra` to the exclusion list so your placement sprites aren't muddled.
@chrisforbes Sadly Tiberian Sun only comes with an ambient music track, not individual thunder sounds. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CPQjBdzFc0g

Couldn't it be possible to use the ionstorm.aud file from one of the archive files from:
http://ppmsite.com/forum/viewtopic.php?p=176676&sid=5475908551288848a51347b62b187e69 ?

I'd vote against it. It neither sounds clear enough, nor is really suitable for a single lightning.
We should get a proper thunder sound (or cut one from that file) and use that. We don't need to play a whole 30+ seconds of sounds and hope one of them matches a lightning. We can do sound per lightning, as it should be.

@Mailaender I've cut ionstorm.aud into pieces, you can find the flash*.auds in this branch: https://github.com/reaperrr/OpenRA/tree/flash-sounds

If they're good enough, feel free to use them.
to be honest, I didn't listen to the .aud file from the archive. I thought (hoped) it was not a 30 seconds long sound file. Thanks @reaperrr

Okay, here you go. I added synchronized thunder :zap: sound, too.

Use the following to try it out with @reaperrr's demo files:

``` yaml
Rules:
    World:
        GlobalPaletteEffect:
            Flash: true
        Thunder:
            SoundFiles: flash01.aud, flash02.aud, flash03.aud, flash04.aud, flash05.aud, flash06.aud, flash07.aud, flash08.aud, flash09.aud
```

Also added a looping sound trait now. Use the following with the sound file examples supplied by @chrisforbes to add more effects such as :umbrella: to a map of your liking:

``` yaml
Rules:
    World:
        GlobalPaletteEffect:
            Flash: true
        Thunder:
            SoundFiles: thunder.aud
        LoopedSound:
            SoundFile: rain.aud
```

The relationship between `GlobalPaletteEffect` and `Thunder` doesn't make a lot of sense.  It would be much cleaner if `GlobalPaletteEffect` did the global palette effect (and no more), and then you had a subclass `StormPaletteEffect` that added the flashing and sound files on top.

Modularized it even further as suggested.

``` yaml
Rules:
    World:
        GlobalPaletteEffect:
        FlashPaletteEffect:
#       AmbientSound:
#           SoundFile: rain.aud
        Thunder:
            SoundFiles: thunder.aud
```

This (with my requested changes) nicely complements #7853:

![lights](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/6997676/fc6132c8-dbbc-11e4-8b23-8aaf43b600c4.png)
Updated.
Updated.

:+1: for code and ingame effects.

4fac981c643f387ec54a0a249596452b395bebf2 are the lighting effects for our current two maps, and i'll include lighting in a future version of the ts map importer.

Ion storms use lighting parameters around (each mission seems to be different):

```
Ambient: 0.5
Red: 1.62
Green: 1.25
Blue: 0.34
```
Updated with the lightning parameters for the imported TS maps and more fine grained ways to control what palettes are affected.
Works ingame and is fun to play with. :+1: once my comments are addressed.
Updated.
Mailaender, with this PR we should add a epileptic warning on game start and add an option in the settings dialog to disable effects which are strange for epileptic :/
This is just doing permanent lightning. I split off https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7872.
[Changelog](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog-%28bleed%29/_compare/4c1ca0b2e321748af31af1e7749e47f63d6b21b6...bf31fd9d673e8f7d79ca4e487eef085e8b68cb29)
